fdd:FDD.titleName: Expert Witness Disk Image, EnCase E01 Bitstream

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:fullName: Expert Witness Compression Format, EnCase E01 Bitstream

fdd:description.p: First version of the EWF bitstream or forensic image format from Guidance Software (EnCase brand), generally similar to the description offered in EWF_Family. This and the counterpart EWF_L01 format offer three levels of compression: "no," "good," and "best."
EWF_E01 files contain 13 sections; the first four are carried over from EWF_SMART:

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: First version of the EWF bitstream or forensic image format from Guidance Software (EnCase brand).
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:productionPhase: Typically used for data analysis and not part of a process to create new content. May be used to archive data.

fdd:relatedTo.fdd:titleName: Expert Witness Format, Encase Ex01 Bitstream

fdd:localUse.fdd:experience: EWF_E01 disk images are produced by the Tangible Media Preservation Project, which began in or about 2013.

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:disclosure: Open documentation produced via reverse engineering by Joachim Metz.

fdd:documentation.a: EWF specification: Expert Witness Compression Format specification

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:adoption: In archives (as distinct from legal and law enforcement settings), where tools like Bit Curator and FTK Imager are in wide use, user comments suggest that EWF_E01 is one of the more frequently employed formats.

fdd:filenameExtension.fdd:note: Filename extensions for the first 99 content segments are .E01, .E02, through .E99; followed by .EAA, .EAB, and so on.

fdd:magicNumbers.fdd:note: From Gary Kessler's File Signatures Table.

fdd:general.p: Joachim Metz's analysis highlights the details of this format, including variation in the structure of .E01 headers, in part depending on the version of the EnCase tool used to create the file (pp. 5-13), note on the .E01 header when a file is created by FTK Imager (p. 14), and notes on variations in the volume section according to the creating application (pp. 18-20).

fdd:urlReference.tag: EWF specification: Expert Witness Compression Format specification
fdd:urlReference.comment: Joachim Metz's reverse-engineered documentation of EWF subtypes including EWF_E01.
Free tool from AccessData, also the source for the more extensive FTK Toolkit.
Tool to support digital content management, including work with disk images and forensic analysis.
Information in PRONOM from UK National Archives about Encase Image File Format/Expert Witness Compression Format. PUID: fmt/803.
